Food redistribution/free food projects in Nottingham

Last Modified: 12 Jan 2026

  • Himmah Food Bank Himmah operate the largest independent food bank in Nottingham, offer hot meals every week, distribute school uniforms to low-income families, and campaign to eradicate disproportionality in stop and searches, among other crucial initiatives.
  • Salaam Shalom Kitchen A Jewish-Muslim partnership organisation that works out of the Himmah hub, and offers hot meals and take-away groceries to anyone in need. You do not need a referral to turn up.
  • Foodprint Social supermarket supplied by food distribution partners. Food is redistributed to those experiencing food poverty in Nottingham, via Foodprint's network of community-eating cafes, food banks, and school breakfast clubs, or directly through their brick-and-mortar shop in Sneinton Market. They make good food accessible and affordable to everyone who needs it.
  • Tiger Community CIC A welcoming, friendly space for people to come together. The Community Cafes offer free hot meals. Tiger Community also deliver a range of activities to support mental health and well-being.
  • Dolls Dining Co-Op A transfem led co-operative, providing free food for transfems in Nottingham.
  • Emmanuel House Meal services Emmanuel House are a charity who provide hot meals and other free welfare and legal services to people who are homeless and/or don't have access to public funds.
  • Guru Nanak's Mission Inspired by the Sikh principles of langar, GNM provide free meals to the homeless and vulnerable in Nottingham. Their goal is not only to alleviate hunger but also to create a sense of community and belonging. (You do not have to be a Sikh to access their help.)
  • Muslim Hands - Open Kitchen The Open Kitchen provides a place to pick up a hot meal, access to water and also, a friendly word with the team. They also provide groceries that people can take away including fruit, vegetables, sauces, milk and water. Muslim Hands co-operate with Framework, to help visitors access social housing.
  • NottsHelpYourself Food Support Free groups offering food, and downloadable resources for recipes and kitchen skills.
  • FareShare East Midlands Midlands charity who distribute large volumes of surplus food to charities and community groups.
